creator: mgeich5+apachebug@gmail.com
text: I am trying to deploy a tomcat webapp with Ant deploy task but the version does not seem to be considered. When I deploy a file with name ROOT##003 the version is not considered and instead of deploying version 003 it tries to deploy with an unspecified version.

creator: chris@christopherschultz.net
text: Can you give an example of your ant script?
The file name is ignored. You need to set the version parameter.
creator: markt@apache.org

text:
The code I am using

<target name="tomcat.deploy" >
	  <deploy url="http://localhost:8080/manager/text" username="${deploy.user}" password="${deploy.pass}" path="/" war="file:ROOT%23%23${version}.war"/>                   
</target>

(the %23 are the '#' characters)

How can I specify the version in this case?
